2019-h1-1-1-2: The easiest way to generate a Common Multiple for a set of fractions, is to mutliple together their numerators
Multiply each fraction by the Common Multiple
After multiplying, the numerator of each fraction cancels out with one of the terms of the Common Multiple
Multiply out the brackets, and combine like terms
Notice that each is a multiple of 3, so we can divide by 3 to simplify.

Connect these points to graph the line g(x)
